title: No such thing as strategic state-owned enterprises, says Finance Minister Aurangzeb
description: Says longer, larger IMF programme needed to bring "permanence in macroeconomic stability and structural reforms".

title: Second night of auroras seen amid ‘extreme’ solar storm
description: No major disruptions to power or communications networks appear to have been reported this time around.

title: Canada arrests fourth Indian national in killing of Sikh activist
description: The Indian national was already being held for unrelated gun charges.

title: FIFA’s foul on Pakistan football
description: Is a franchise system like cricket’s PSL the best way forward? And why is an interim football administration pushing for it?

title: Smokers’ corner: Khan and the generals
description: Imran was convinced that May 9-10 protests were an attempt to rally support amongst "pro-Khan" factions in the military. However, any military intervention was drastically overestimated by his supporters.

title: IMF endorses status quo in SBP’s policy rate
description: “The IMF staff endorsed the SBP’s Monetary Policy Committee decision to maintain the policy rate,” says report.

title: Concerns that Modi’s rhetoric might incite further violence against Indian Muslims are increasing
description: Analysts are pointing out the BJP regime's fascist tendencies and departure from moorings of pluralism and secularism.

title: How the insurgency in Balochistan is evolving
description: Whenever anger flares against the state’s flawed policies, settlers become the targets.

title: Sindh’s riverine region in the crosshairs of militia violence
description: Bugtis, allegedly backed by Punjab police, infiltrating Ghotki's Rwanti on the Sindh-Punjab border adds a new layer of complexity to the ongoing operation.

title: Editorial: It is imperative for the state to reconsider its approach to human rights
description: Govt must ensure judiciary's independence, respect for democratic processes, and protection for all citizens against abuse of power.

description: If the chief was able to weather that storm then, he appears far more secure now.

description: Say ECP’s "partiality" in Feb 8 elections evident to all.

title: KP fears ‘denial’ of Rs300bn funds by centre
description: CM aide says despite financial issues, no compromise on govt’s social welfare commitments.

title: Female teachers in Islamabad urge PM to resolve wedlock policy issue
description: The teachers were once employees of the provincial govts and divisions, but were brought to Islamabad under the wedlock policy.

title: US offers maximum number of scholarship, fellowship programmes: Ambassador Blome
description: Ambassador Blome says besides providing a large number of scholarships, the US was also contributing to school education.

title: Pakistan, Azerbaijan to launch joint climate transparency report
description: The two sides announce launching a joint climate transparency report at the upcoming global climate summit, COP-29.

title: Pakistan Railway police hand over 31 runaway kids to parents
description: Three were found in Multan and Sukkur divisions while Karachi and Quetta handed over 4 and 2 children.

title: Breach of guidelines to curb child marriage: LHC orders action against nikah registrar
description: Justice Pannun observes that marriage registrars, without relying upon any document, mention the age of the bride as 18 years or above.

title: Punjab govt to provide eyeglasses, hearing aids to 0.7m schoolchildren
description: German company's official assures CM Maryam of his support for the welfare projects in province.

title: Doctors, paramedics in Larkana to intensify protest over FIR against CMCH head, seven doctors
description: A lawyer had last month filed FIR over 19-year-old daughter dying during treatment.

title: Nawabshah’s Zardari clan agrees to pay Rs50m, surrender land for killing five Bhands, police inspector
description: Settlement announced by SUP arbitrator after 26 months of negotiations.

title: Mayor Wahab seeks businessmen’s help for Karachi’s uplift
description: “We often try to find solutions from wrong platforms,” Murtaza Wahab says in reference to petitions filed against different KMC moves.

title: Love knows no boundaries at Karachi’s Edhi Home nursery for special children
description: When parents discover their babies are "not well", they quietly leave them in our cot, says Sabah Edhi as country celebrates Mother’s Day today.

title: Washington says use of its weapons by Tel Aviv in Gaza violated law
description: US report says it was “reasonable to assess” that Israel has used weapons in ways inconsistent with international humanitarian law.

title: Art group employs brainwaves, AI to  recreate landscapes
description: “We’ve known for around 10 years that it’s possible to reconstruct a viewed image from the activity of the visual cortex,” says researcher.

description: The two women hold up a sign saying  “The government is breaking the law” after attaching themselves to the display case.

title: Adoption of Palestine resolution to put pressure on US: Munir Akram

title: Delhi CM Kejriwal exhorts Indians to resist ‘dictatorship’

description: Macron says he hopes Mbappe would play in this year’s Olympic Games.

description: A preliminary probe reveals that these companies engaged in advertising their products as “natural, organic, sustainable, pure, and chemical-free” without any scientific evidence.

description: Interview with an Arab news channel comes days after a Saudi investors’ delegation visited Pakistan.

Spanish adventure athlete Antonio de la Rosa attempted to row alone through the roughest seas on the planet to Antarctica. Very little went according to plan.
Cardamom and pistachios flavour this smooth and creamy frozen treat, which has origins dating as far back as the 16th Century.
As of 1 December, Fiji instituted a quarantine-free travel policy to welcome vaccinated travellers from countries across the globe.
The James Beard award-winning chef's ancestral soup combines a richly simmered broth with herbs, avocado and traditional mofongo balls: garlicky twice-fried mashed green plantains.
Deeply rooted in Costa Rican and Nicaraguan culture, this staple of rice and beans with a side of eggs gets a spicy kick from Salsa Lizano (a sauce similar to Worcestershire).
The idea of seasonal eating reaches its apotheosis in Sweden on Midsummer Eve, a magical day of feasting where a cake layered with strawberries and cream is the crowning glory.
Egypt may have the Pyramids of Giza, but Iraq has the Ziggurat of Ur – an incredibly well-preserved engineering achievement that towers over the ruins of an important ancient city.
Stretching 113 miles into the open ocean, this engineering marvel linked the far-flung Florida Keys to the mainland and forever changed Florida.
Living on a remote, barren isle bestowed with few resources, the Rapanui needed to combine ingenious design with flawless sculpting to move the massive moai without any machinery.
Beer archaeologists are peering back millennia to recreate brews from ancient Egypt, Greece and Rome using ancient methods and ingredients.
Long known as the heart of the city's Latinx scene, the Mission has blossomed into a melting pot of cool. Loló co-owner Jorge Martinez Lillard shares his tips on what to do nearby.
Run by the same family for the past 12 generations, this more-than-300-year-old inn is considered one of the finest in all of Japan.
Celebrity chef Alexandre Mazzia will be a torchbearer when the Paris 2024 Olympics kick off in his hometown of Marseille. Here is his guide to the city, from sunsets to seafood.
The aurora borealis was visible around the world on Friday night, stunning photographers everywhere.
The Little Mariana fruit bat slipped into oblivion before scientists even had the chance to learn about its biology or behaviour.
More than 100 people are injured, according to officials, as torrents of water sweep through entire villages.
In 2010 Laurent Ballesta stared directly into the eyes of a creature once thought to be extinct – and took the first ever photograph of a living coelacanth.
A growing group of conscious consumers have found other strategies than flat-out boycotts to hold firms accountable.
As the cost of living rises and loneliness becomes a global concern, "intentional communites" are increasingly popular. We meet co-living members to explore the pros and cons.

title: Northern Lights captured glowing over the UK
description: Time-lapse video shows swirls of green, pink and scarlet moving across the night sky in Nottingham.
The Israeli military tells thousands of Palestinians to leave the city as it expands its military operation.

title: Northern Lights captured glowing over the UK
description: Time-lapse video shows swirls of green, pink and scarlet moving across the night sky in Nottingham.

title: Seven key moments from today's show
description: There's plenty to unpack from today's Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg programme, during which the Israel-Gaza war and Tory defection dominated the agenda.

title: 'I had nostalgia watching Harry and Meghan this week' - Tina Brown
description: We're now hearing from the panel before this week's programme wraps up.

title: I’ve played Prince Charles - I’d love to be a Bond villain, West says
description: The Crown leads in this year’s BAFTA TV nominations - up for eight awards later this evening.

title: Crown star Dominic West talks about new West End play
description: Next up on the show is Dominic West - star of so many huge TV shows and films, but perhaps most recently known for his role as Prince Charles in Netflix’s series The Crown.

title: Ashworth hits out at 'outrageous' hire and rehire practice
description: Labour MP Jonathan Ashworth is next asked about workers' rights.

title: Elphicke defected to Labour over Tory government 'disintegration' - Ashworth
description: More now on Natalie Elphicke's defection and the story this morning which details allegations the Dover MP lobbied ministers over her then-husband Charlie's sexual assault case.

title: Labour MP Jonathan Ashworth asked whether UK should stop arms sales to Israel
description: Jonathan Ashworth, who has served as shadow paymaster general since September 2023 and is a Labour MP for Leicester South, is now in the hot seat.

title: Former chancellor quizzed on tax affairs
description: "My heart said keeping going, but the head said let a younger person fight an election," Nadhim Zahawi says on why he'll be stepping down as an MP.

title: Zahawi discusses why he's standing down at next election
description: We're now hearing from panellist and former Chancellor Nadhim Zahawi who this week announced he would be standing down as an MP at the next election.

title: Elphicke now a Labour press office problem, Cameron says
description: Turning now to Natalie Elphicke - the MP who defected from the Conservatives to Labour on Wednesday - Laura asks David Cameron about allegations of lobbying over her then-husband's sexual assault case.

title: Is this the start of a major offensive in Ukraine?
description: David Cameron is next asked about Ukraine, after recent attacks on Kharkiv and Russian advances in the city.

title: British boots on the ground in Gaza a risk we should not take - Cameron
description: Laura presses the foreign secretary about the UK's role in getting aid into Gaza - one idea she mentions was British troops helping get supplies from a pier built by the US onto the beaches in Gaza.

title: Israel's performance on aid has not been good enough, says foreign secretary
description: Cameron goes on to say the US "is in a totally different position" to the UK on arms sales.

title: Cameron challenged on arms exports to Israel
description: David Cameron continues to be questioned about Israel's planned offensive in Rafah and if it is a point of principle for the UK to send a strong political message and stop arms sales to Israel.

title: We don't support a major operation in Rafah, Cameron says
description: First up in the studio is the foreign secretary who is asked by Laura about the ongoing conflict in the Gaza Strip as she cites the UN chief in the last hour reiterating calls for an immediate ceasefire.

title: Who are today’s panellists?
description: This week's show is under way and we're now hearing from the panel, who are discussing the situation in the Middle East. Here's who's in the studio with Laura:

title: A quick glance at Sunday's front pages
description: First up Laura takes a look at the Sunday papers, some of which feature fresh reports about the new Labour MP Natalie Elphicke.

title: And we’re live
description: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg is now live on BBC One, the BBC News Channel and BBC iPlayer.

title: New Labour MP Elphicke accused of lobbying over husband's sexual assault case
description: Nick Eardley

title: Gaza latest: Overnight strikes in Rafah after Israel ordered evacuation
description: As we've mentioned, the Middle East is likely to be a focal point in today's programme, so let's bring you the latest from the region.
India's Virat Kohli (left), England's Jos Buttler (centre) and Australia's Pat Cummins (right) will all be key figures for their sides
Lauren Price is a world champion after just seven professional fights
James Anderson (front) has taken 60 wickets in 18 Tests since Brendon McCullum (back) became England head coach
